official-title.#text:
To amend part B of title XVIII of the Social Security Act
		  to reform Medicare payment for physicians’ services by eliminating the
		  sustainable growth rate system and providing incentives for the adoption of
		  innovative payment and delivery models to improve quality and
		  efficiency.

committee-name.#tail:
, and in
			 addition to the Committee on

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the
			 Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the
			 jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Medicare Physician Payment
			 Innovation Act of 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited
			 as the

The
			 purpose of this Act is to reform the system of Medicare payment for physicians’
			 services—

by ending the
			 application of the sustainable growth rate (SGR) system;

to promote the
			 rapid development and implementation of alternative improved payment and
			 delivery models that incentivize high quality, high-value care; and

to provide
			 continuing incentives for adoption of such alternative payment and delivery
			 models by physicians and other providers.
